item.title: About
item.description: I’m a cloud consultant with nearly 20 years of experience in cloud computing, DevOps, Infrastructure as Code, networking, and Python development. I write about the intersection of technology and business - the practical realities of building systems that actually work, and the lessons learned from doing it wrong first. What I do By day, I help organisations navigate the complexities of cloud architecture, automation, and modern infrastructure. I’ve worked across AWS, Azure, Kubernetes, and just about every flavour of infrastructure tooling that’s existed over the past two decades.

item.title: Contact
item.description: I’m always interested in hearing about interesting cloud and DevOps challenges, potential consulting opportunities, or just connecting with like-minded professionals. Get in Touch The best way to reach me is via email: hello@benkelly.dev Connect on Social Find me on X or LinkedIn for more regular updates, thoughts on cloud architecture, and industry insights. What I Can Help With Cloud architecture and infrastructure design (AWS, Azure) DevOps transformation and automation Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation) Kubernetes and container orchestration Technical consulting and advisory Whether you’re looking to discuss a project, need some advice, or just want to chat about technology—I’d love to hear from you.

item.title: Hello World
item.description: After nearly 20 years in cloud and DevOps, I’m finally putting words on the internet. Here’s why. The case for writing I’ve spent most of my career solving problems, building systems, and explaining technical concepts to people who needed to make decisions about them. What I haven’t done is write publicly. That changes now. What to expect I’ll be writing about: Cloud architecture and DevOps — the practical stuff, not the vendor marketing Building things — lessons from consulting, side projects, and everything in between The business of technology — because technical excellence that doesn’t ship is just expensive procrastination The format Longer posts will live here.

item.title: AWS Architecture Patterns: Building Resilient Cloud Infrastructure
item.description: After years of building and consulting on AWS infrastructure, I’ve seen the same architectural patterns emerge time and again. These aren’t theoretical exercises—they’re battle-tested approaches that solve real problems at scale. The Three-Tier Architecture: Still Relevant in 2026 Despite the rise of serverless and containerized workloads, the three-tier architecture remains foundational.
